submission_requirements.deploy_to: Google Cloud Run (must be live and functional)
submission_requirements.embed_in_post: Use Cloud Run embed feature in your DEV post

critical_rules: Include significant original contributions, credit all reused code
Add MIT/Apache/BSD license to your repo
Write in English for prize eligibility

winning_strategies.goal: Practical, judge-focused steps to maximize your chances of winning based on the official criteria and judge behavior.
general_tips: Start with a clear, compelling hero section that states who you are and what you built (one-liner + demo).
Target the judging criteria directly: show innovation, robust technical implementation, and excellent UX in distinct sections of your post.
Make your submission English-friendly for prize consideration (write captions and summaries in English).
innovation_and_creativity: Showcase a unique idea or twist — don’t only change visuals; add new features, AI-driven interactions, or novel presentation formats.
Describe design decisions and trade-offs so judges understand why your approach is novel and meaningful.
technical_implementation: Provide a public GitHub repo with a clear README, deployment instructions, and a short architecture/tech overview.
Use Google AI tools where relevant (AI Studio/Gemini) and include a short “How AI was used” section with code snippets or prompts so judges can verify your technical work.
Ensure reliability: use Cloud Run with health checks, fast cold-start configuration, and test/embed the live app in your DEV post before publishing.
user_experience: Prioritize accessibility, responsiveness, and performance; include screenshots or short GIFs highlighting interactions.
Include a guided tour or ‘what to try’ section so judges can quickly experience the product’s highlights.
presentation_and_submission: Embed your Cloud Run deployment correctly and confirm it loads inside the DEV post (test on desktop and mobile).
Use the submission template and add `--labels dev-tutorial=devnewyear2026` to your post so it’s properly collected for judging.
Be transparent: explicitly list reused work, dependencies, and any third-party assets or templates you built on.
community_and_reactions: Share your DEV post with your network and relevant communities to gain early positive reactions (ties are broken by positive reactions).
Engage with commenters professionally — constructive engagement can increase visibility and reactions.
compliance_and_legal: Include a license for your code (MIT/Apache/BSD recommended) and cite any third-party code or assets used.
Confirm eligibility and rule compliance; if you are unsure, consult the Official Rules link provided above.
final_checklist_before_publish: Live Cloud Run URL embedded and working in DEV post
DEV post uses the submission template and includes the challenge label
Public GitHub repo with README, license, and usage notes
Short ‘How AI was used’ section and code snippets where applicable
Screenshots/GIFs and ‘what to try’ guide for judges
Post written in English (if you want to be prize-eligible)
